oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Volunteer Army Ammunition Plant wood shop workers
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space
Work
African Americans; Woodworkers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two African American males working in the wood shop of the Volunteer Army Ammunition Plant.

The Volunteer Army Ammunition Plant was established in Chattanooga in 1941 to produce TNT for the war effort. The plant was reactivated during the Korean War, producing TNT until 1957. Production resumed in 1966 for the Vietnam War.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Volunteer Army Ammunition Plant Photographs, 194- to 197-, Jeffrey W. Cash, Collector.
